comment._content: In December 1913, the New York TImes reported on the arrival of Carrie T. Van Gaasbeck, Alfred A. Berger, and J. T. Price, three tuberculosis survivors who hiked from Los Angeles to Washington DC to deliver a letter asking President Wilson for research on tuberculosis treatments and cures. The hiking, in winter, was part of the demonstration that they were, indeed, cured of TB. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9801E1D6103FE633A...
